docs.lead_paragraph: A HUNDRED yards back from a white stone road an old man bent over a hoe under the blazing sun of a day in July. 1923, and dug weeds out of a potato patch. In the next field peasants men and women, were cutting grain with scythes, refreshing, themselves now and then with draughts of wine from big stone bottles.

headline.main: FIVE YEARS AFTER, ON THE OLD FRONT LINE; Two A.E.F. Veterans Return to France

docs.abstract: Articles by 3 A E F sergeants after revisiting France

docs.lead_paragraph: A SPECIAL, presentation of a film prepared by the United States Public Health Service, in response to many requests received, will be given at the Capitol Theatre at 10:45 A.M. next Saturday. This showing, which is solely for women, will be under the auspices of the Vocational Adjustment Bureau for Girls, to which organization the proceeds will go.

docs.lead_paragraph: Assemblyman Louis A. Cuvillier was held for the Grand Jury yesterday on a Charge of criminally libeling Police Commissioner Enright by sending a telegram last April referring to "Enright and his graft collectors" in connection with charges of police corruption in prohibition enforcement.

headline.main: CUVILLIER IS HELD, CORRIGAN CLEARED OF LIBEL ON ENRIGHT; Crain Decides That Liquor Graft Charges Against Commissioner Are "Unsustained."

docs.abstract: text of Judge Crain's decision by which Cuvillier is held, Corrigan cleared of libel on Enright, statements by Enright and Cuvillier, civil suits will be pressed, Lambert and Morrison called before First Deputy Police Comr J A Leach

headline.main: STILLMAN PUBLISHES WIFE'S 'CONFESSION'; Files Letter, Barred by Referee, in Appeal From His Adverse Decision. INDIAN BABY" MENTIONED Authenticity of the Unsigned Document Was Denied at Previous Trial. STILLMAN PUBLISHES WIFE'S 'CONFESSION'
